Mizoribine selectively inhibits the synthesis of guanosine monophosphate from inosine 5 -monophosphate in the purine metabolism pathway in immune cells [23]. In juvenile idiopathic arthritis, inXammatory cells from small vessels are inWltrated into the synovial tissue and produce cytokines including interleukin-1, interleukin-6, tumor necrosis factor-alpha, interferon-gamma, and interleukin-18 [26]. Mizoribine decreased intracellular production and extracellular release of interleukin-1 and interleukin-6 from peripheral monocytes of RA patients [29].
